conclusion: Liquid starts at points A, B, and C and flows downward due to gravity.
Liquid from point A flows down and encounters the first baffle (cyan).
The cyan baffle directs the liquid from point A to the right.
Liquid from point A continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (red).
The red baffle directs the liquid from point A further to the right.
Liquid from point A continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (white).
The white baffle directs the liquid from point A further to the right.
Liquid from point A continues to the right and flows into container G.
Liquid from point B flows down and encounters the first baffle (cyan).
The cyan baffle directs the liquid from point B to the right.
Liquid from point B continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (red).
The red baffle directs the liquid from point B further to the right.
Liquid from point B continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (white).
The white baffle directs the liquid from point B further to the right.
Liquid from point B continues to the right and flows into container G.
Liquid from point C flows down and encounters the first baffle (cyan).
The cyan baffle directs the liquid from point C to the right.
Liquid from point C continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (red).
The red baffle directs the liquid from point C further to the right.
Liquid from point C continues to the right and encounters the next baffle (white).
The white baffle directs the liquid from point C further to the right.
Liquid from point C continues to the right and flows into container G.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into container G.
